html.div:
This dashboard shows the size of buckets within an index. More information about indexes and buckets in general can be found here.
Within the panel titled Maximum Bucket Size, two values are shown. The first, labeled "Setting" is the value that appears as the configuration setting maxDataSize within indexes.conf for this index. It is quite common to use a value of either auto or auto_high_volume for this parameter. These values scale depending upon the number of bits in the host's underlying operating system. To understand the actual applied value of the setting for this system, look to the value labeled "Applied".

search.query: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | stats count by orig_host
| inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache where orig_host=$host$ | stats count by orig_index
stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats count
stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats avg(sizeOnDiskMB) AS average | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(average)`

| `_fb_rest_index_config($host$, $index$)` | join type=left splunk_server [ | rest /services/server/info splunk_server=$host$ ] | eval bucket_max=if(maxDataSize=="auto", 750, if(maxDataSize=="auto_high_volume", case(cpu_arch=="x86_64", 10000, cpu_arch=="x64", 10000, 1==1, 1000), maxDataSize)) | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(bucket_max)`

chart.title: Bucket Sizes with Overlay, Local Buckets Only

search.query: extract auto=f fb_extract_bucket_type_time_source | search NOT bucket_type="rb" | eventstats avg(sizeOnDiskMB) AS average | sort 0 id | join type=left index [ | `_fb_rest_index_config($host$, $index$)` ] | join type=left splunk_server [ | rest /services/server/info | fields - id ] | eval bucket_max=case(isint(maxDataSize), maxDataSize, maxDataSize=="auto", 750, cpu_arch="x86_64", 10000, cpu_arch="x64", 10000, 1==1, 1000) | table id, sizeOnDiskMB, average, bucket_max | rename sizeOnDiskMB AS "Bucket Size", average AS "Average Size", bucket_max AS "Size Limit"
